result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 11-2-22

Defendant Joel C Gonzales appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Joel C Gonzales.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Decision Hearing. Court placed on the record findings of fact and legal analysis. Court GRANTED State's Motion for joinder. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 01/20/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-22-22
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE TO MOTION

Defendant Joel C Gonzales in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Arguments heard. Court addresses parties and states that she is not prepared to rule on the motion today, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court adjourns matter for a Decision hearing date to Br 16.  Decision scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-22
Defendant's Response in Opposition to the State's Joinder Motion received and filed.  bm

Defendant Joel C Gonzales in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel C Gonzales appeared by video means with Attorney Poznanski. Defense has received discovery and needs an offer. Court sets deadline to file motion for 07/22/2022 by 5:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Joel C Gonzales not in court, in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced.  Court sets next court date for a Status Conference date, to align with co-actor cases. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.  STATE'S MOTION TO JOIN- Gonzales.pdf
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING  (17 pages) commencing 03-24-2022 by PAULINE GARRY.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 05/05/2022, Br 16.

Defendant Joel C Gonzales in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Joel C Gonzales in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Beckett. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with I.M.H; A.E.V; M.M.L; I.N; C.A.P-F
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joel C Gonzales in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Joel C Gonzales in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel C Gonzales appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
